Comments_List: you learn a lot about genocide

This class provided me with valuable comparative skills. By looking at a (very) wide range of genocides across time, the class was able to simultaneously analyze broad themes and nuances between cases.
I learnt genocidal events from ancient time till today. Throughout the course, I get to know how to do comparative studies and how to conduct a research about genocide.

The course is perfectly organized. The readings are set in a chronological way, which helps us understand the topics in a systematic way. Moreover, we have guest speakers and serial conferences, which helps us know the latest research.

Sure! Prof Kiernan is super kind. He knows how to guide students to conduct research! And the course is really interesting. I can always find inspirations when listening to his interpretation and his questions in class.
